member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.HighLightCellBehavior.#ctor(GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor)
member.summary: The constructor used to build the highlight object.
member.remarks:
This constructor sets various defaults:
CellBrush is set to
BorderPen is set to with Color.Black and a width of 2 pixels.
HtmlPaintFlag is set to TRANSPARENT
HtmlZOrderFlag is set to BELOW_CONTENT
BorderMargin is set to 0 on all borders.

member.summary: Purpose of this class is to provide highlight service for table cells. Each highlight action follows a mouse action and sets a start and an end cell. member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.ResizeBehavior
member.summary: This class controls the table appearance during design time.
member.remarks:
It contains the draw method to draw the white background and the solid border around the whole table. It also draw the activator icon in the upper left corner. It has a predefined implementation of an advanced resizing technique. The default drawing conditions are TRANSPARENT (does not change existing pixels) and BELOW_CONTENT (Content is dominant, all drawings are behind the text/borders/images).
As of version 1.0 the drawing style is hard coded. Future version may have a configuration option here.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.ITableFormatter
member.summary: Represention of a table. Provides table operations like merge, split, delete, and add.
member.remarks: The table formatter is a tool which manipulates the table's rows and columns in various ways. All commands supplied here are synchronous and change the table's DOM immediately. All commands watch the table to hold it in well formed state. Supposedly one calls a method which would result in wrong rendering the command is going to be ignored.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.ITableFormatter.PrevCellPosition(GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.TableCellElement)
member.summary: Takes the current cell and set the caret to previous one.
member.remarks: The caret stops at first cell. If the caret is in the first column and the current row is not the first one, the caret jumps to the last cell of the previous row.
member.returns: True, if successfull, false in case on error

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.ITableFormatter.NextCellPosition(GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.TableCellElement)
member.summary: Takes the current cell and set the caret to next possible cell.
member.remarks: If there is no cell anymore, a new row is created and the caret is placed in the first column of the new row.
member.returns: True, if successfull, false in case on error

member.summary: Deletes the current table and creates a new one with the give parameters. All content will be lost.

member.summary: Add the given caption element to the current table. If no caption exists it will be created.
member.returns: The new created object.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.ITableFormatter.RemoveCaption
member.summary: Removes the caption element from the current table.
member.remarks: Does nothing if no exists.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.ITableFormatter.DeleteTableRow
member.summary: Delete the current row from the table.
member.remarks: The current row is determined by the cell in which the user has placed the caret before the operation starts. After the operation the caret is placed in the first cell of the previous row. If the first row is deleted the caret is placed in the first cell of the first row.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.ITableFormatter.DeleteTableColumn
member.summary: Deletes the current column from table.
member.remarks: The current column is determined by the cell in which the user has placed the caret before the operation starts. After the operation the caret is placed in the first cell of the previous column. If the first column is deleted the caret is placed in the first cell of the first column.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.ITableFormatter.InsertTableRow
member.overloads: Inserts a new row after the current row.
member.summary: Inserts a new row after the current row.

remarks.para: The new row beeing inserted follows the structure of the current row. That means that any merged or splitted cells will be merged or splitted in the new row too.
Inserting a new row can also be done by the TAB key. If the property ProcessTABKey is on and the user hits TAB in the last cell of the last row a new row will be inserted.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.ITableFormatter.InsertTableRow(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts a new row before or after the current row.
member.param: Set this parameter to false to insert the row before the current one.

member.summary: Activates of deactivates the table designer's add mode.
member.remarks: The add mode determines how the resize of the right most column and the right outer border. Usually the table is not being resized if the last column width is being changed. If the add mode is activated, the right most column will grow and the table width is growing accordingly.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableDesigner.SetFormatter(GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor,GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.TableElement,GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.TableCellElement)
member.summary: Sets the current table and cell explicitly.
member.remarks:
The host can use this method to force setting the current table and cell to allow any table formatting operation issued by the table designer working with that table, instead of the user selected one.
Setting the cell is necessary, because many commands use the current cell as a starting point for there operation.
Calling this method will not fire the event. Additionally, the designer and the formatter stay no longer in sync regarding the used table.
member.param: The editor instance, from which the table element comes.
The table, which has to be set.

member.remarks: This information is useful to update related menu items or toolbars.
member.param: The editor this operation refers to.
member.returns: Returns true, if the table designer has a current table.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableDesigner.ResetFormatter(GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor)
member.summary: Put the formatter back into automatic detection mode.
member.remarks: Any caller of the or is supposed to call this method to put the formatter back into detection mode. This means, that the current table follows the mouse and as soon as a mouse move appears on top of a table the current table changes.

member.summary: Activate Table Designer and Behaviors.

member.summary: Activates / Deactivates the slider mode.
member.remarks: It is recommended to turn it off on slow systems (500 MHz and less).

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableDesignerProperties.StaticBehavior
member.summary: If true, all tables on page will render as table mode, otherwise only the active (current) table.

member.summary: Shows advanced information during cell resize like Visual Studio or Dreamweaver.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableDesignerProperties.FastResizeMode
member.summary: Activates / Deactivates the fast resize mode.
member.remarks: Normally the resize mode works in a WYSIWYG manner and shows the result of the next step immediately. With large tables this can be a huge performance flaw. The host application should enable fast resize mode when a table has more than 10 rows or columns and complex content or embedded tables. In that case the slider is automatically turned on and shows the final cell position. The table is redrawn only once after the user releases the mouse button.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableDesignerProperties.ProcessTABKey
member.summary: If true the TAB key will move the caret inside the table.
member.remarks:
This will prevent the TAB key from beeing moved around through the controls collection of the form. To get the normal behavior of the TAB key this option must be set to false.
If the table designer is not activated the TAB key has always there normal behavior.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableDesignerProperties.SliderAddMode
member.summary: The used to modify the slider behavior.
member.remarks: If true the current column or row will grow/shrink and the previous column or row will not change their widht or height, respectively. This results in a growing/shrinking table.

member.summary: The background color of the whole table used during design mode.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableEditDesigner
member.summary: The TableDesigner class realises all mouse and key related operations against tables.
member.remarks:
It recognizes keystrokes to set current cell, move caret with TAB key, detect mouse over cell borders to do cell width and height changes, table resize, and cell selection.
See also for additonal table operations based on the cell collection the table designer can store based on cell selection operations.

member.summary: This field is true if a cell should loose their style attribute before a new slider operation sets a new start value. This is delayed from the cell collection gather method to the SetRow/SetCol methods to avoid flicker.

member.summary: Detects the slider area and return the column or row number or -1 if no inside the area. As column is always the left one returned (as row the top one), even if the left area of the right cell was detected, or the top area of the bottom cell, respectively.
member.returns: True if inside the area, false else.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableEditDesigner.GetSelection(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method detects the cell selection area (left zone in cell to cell selection, top of columns for column selection and right zone of left column for row selection). The method will overwrite the CurrentRow or CurrentCol properties to set the right values for subsequent parts of the designer.
member.returns: true if found a hit zone.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableEditDesigner.GuruComponents#Netrix#ComInterop#Interop#IHTMLEditDesigner#PreHandleEvent(System.Int32,GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.IHTMLEventObj)
member.summary:
The implementation of PreHandleEvent. This method is called as a callback before an event is processed by other hosts or MSHTML.
This method does only cover mouse related operations. To set the current table for formatting options the class covers key and click events and sets the current table only when the caret is inside the table. That means that table formatting depends on the caret, whereas table resizing depends on the mouse position. There is one exception from this rule: If the user selects cells with the highlight service this means that cells are well defined, even when the caret is outside the table. In that special case the current table is set too and the formatter options can applied to the selection.
member.param: The event object, which contains details about event source and type
member.returns: S_OK if no further processing needed, S_FALSE else.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableEditDesigner.GuruComponents#Netrix#ComInterop#Interop#IHTMLEditDesigner#PostHandleEvent(System.Int32,GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.IHTMLEventObj)

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableFormatter.CanMergeCells
member.summary: Determines whether the current cellstack is a rectangular are which can merge without destroying table structure.
member.remarks: The MergeCells method will always try to merge the cells available in the stack. However, this might destroy table structure and result in weird table layout. Even if it's possible to correct this, the way depends on desired behavior of the host application. To avoid this, check whether the collection is rectangular using this property.

member.remarks:
This property gets or sets cell collection, which must belong to the current table. If set by user action the cells are highlighted, though, this option does not highlight the cells but subsequent operations will operate on this collection like highlighted cells would be.
Returns null (Nothing in VB.NET) if there is no current selection.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableFormatterProperties.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of a property bag, that influence the table formatter behavior.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableFormatterProperties.ToString
member.summary: Supports the propertygrid element.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableFormatterProperties.CaretAfterDeletion
member.summary: Gets or sets how the caret is positioned if the caret was in the cell, row, or column that has been removed.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableFormatterProperties.NewElementPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets how where new element appears following the position of the caret.
member.remarks: The options After and Before refer to the caret's position. The options First and Last ignore the caret's position and add the element at the respective positions.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableFormatterProperties.KeepOppositePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets how the caret is set according to current row if a column has been deleted, or to current column, if a row has been deleted.
member.remarks:
In a grid-like table you can remove cells, rows, or columns, like this:
[ 1 ]|[ 4 ]|[ 7 ] [ 2 ]|[ 5 ]|[ 8 ] [ 3 ]|[ 6 ]|[ 9 ]
Say the caret is in cell 6 and the user calls the DeleteRow method with property set to Before. This command removes cells 3, 6, and 9. The cursor is placed in the row before, which consists of cells 2, 5, and 8 respectively. If KeepOppositePosition is true, the caret appears in cell 5. If it is false, it would appear in 2.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableFormatterProperties.BeforeText
member.summary: If the caret is placed in the new cell after a delete operation, this properties determines where it appears. If true, it appears before the text, otherwise at the end.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.TableDesigner.TableFormatterProperties.DeleteFollowsSelection
member.summary: If the caret is placed in the new cell after a delete operation, this properties determines where it appears. If true, it appears before the text, otherwise at the end.
